DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of vital signs measurement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vital Signs Domain Diastolic Blood Pressure Vital Signs Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to vital sign._The minimum pressure exerted into the systemic arterial circulation during cardiac ventricular relaxation and filling._The physical portion of the body at which the vital signs assessment takes place.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the anatomical locat
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the anatomical location where the diastolic blood pressure measurement was taken?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not pre-printed on CRF.

ReferenceDocuments.name: VSLOC
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Example: ARM for blood pressure. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
